title: Actors Win Big at the Bafta Awards
summary: The Bafta awards are a big event for movies and actors. This year, Robert Aramayo won best actor for his role in I Swear, where he played a man with Tourette's syndrome. He also won the rising star award, which is for new actors. Jessie Buckley won best actress for her role in Hamnet, where she played Shakespeare's wife. This is the first time an Irish actress has won this award. The Prince and Princess of Wales attended the event and talked about the movies. Another movie, One Battle After Another, won six awards, including best film. The awards show was exciting with many winners.

background_read: The Bafta awards are like the Oscars but in Britain, celebrating the best in film. Actors work hard to make movies, and winning a Bafta is a big honor. This article talks about who won prizes this year, including new actors and famous ones. It also mentions royal family members who watched the movies. Learning about awards shows helps us understand how movies are appreciated and who the stars are.
